intro: Eloyella dalstroemii, commonly known as the glassy fanflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly known as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting well to poor soil conditions. Eloyella dalstroemii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to withstand drought.
